author: Kalyani
content: Wow, the code looks awesome, but is there any way that I store all the visited pages to a text document. I need it for my project.

author: pdp
content: Well, you need a server that will handle all the gathered data and then store it into a simple text file. You can use PHP or any other scripting language for this purpose.

author: Nadav
content: Hi, I have tested this javascript-visited-link-scanner on several computers that have IE7 installed. Unfortuantly it didn't worked. Am i doing something wrong, Or this a known problem with this java script scanner?

author: pdp
content: jk, it is useful if you want to detect where the user has been before arriving on the malicious site.

author: alf
content: Your demo doesn't work in Safari. (the approach works, though)

author: pdp
content: alf, that might be the case. keep in mind though that the latest stuff are inside AttackAPI.

author: kalyani
content: Hey, I looked at java script, can you explain me where are you stealing the history from, I didn't get the trick

author: dude1
content: yeah no go in ie6 windows for me... kind of pissed I didn't test it on the site beforehand. :(

author: pdp
content: the technique has been improved drastically since its discovery. You should be able to find better code in AttackAPI. Nevertheless, the current version of AttackAPI is a bit broken. I will try to fix it at some point in the future when I have got some time.
